page.title: 13SPETISBURY SCHOOL ASSOC.
page.content: A Parents' Association had been under discussion for some years. In view of educational cut backs it was thought that such an association might give support and raise funds for extra facilities. The Headteacher and staff were in agreement. A committee was formed. The first project commissioned was an adventure playground. The first money making venture was a Sports Barbeque evening-a financial and a social success. A large donation from the local Vintage Car Rally, Bingo & Disco evenings produced more revenue. More than Â£6OO was raised. By July 1985 the first part of the adventure playground was finished and being enjoyed by the children. We have subsidised school milk and run a cycling proficiency course.
